If you love the flora and pleasant weather, then visit Canada to see some of the most stunning parks. Book cheap flights to Canada online and experience the beauty with your own eyes. Here is a lowdown of parks you should visit while in Alberta and British Columbia in Canada…. In Alberta: - 1. Banff National Park: This is the country’s oldest park and cannot be missed. Banff National Park offers outstanding display of outdoor escapes. You will see mountain glaciers to hot springs in this gorgeous park! Fish Creek Park: The Fish Creek Park is known as one of the largest urban parks in Canada. It is three times the size of Vancouver’s Stanley Park. The breathtaking beauty of this park will leave you speechless. Jasper National Park: Reconnect with natural beauty and your inner self at this park. You will see picturesque views of Rockies, the universe coming alive at night and soothing water bodies. The Royal Astronomical Society of Canada has officially named this national park as a Dark Shy Preserve. One visit to this national park and you will never want to leave the place. Dinosaur Provincial Park: About forty different species of dinosaurs have been discovered at this park. The UNESCO heritage site is one of the richest regions for fossils in the entire world. 
In British Columbia: - Glacier National Park: Enjoy the cold weather and mountain views while at Glacier National Park. This park is a home to one of the largest cave systems in the country. It has around 5.9 km of passages, which have been explored so far. Khutzeymateen Grizzly Bear Sanctuary:- If you love bears, then this is where you should go once at least. It is a provincial park and a protecting space for grizzly bears in the country. Kootenay National Park: If you love nature’s colours, glaciers, and drop dead gorgeous views, then you should add this park to your list. The early morning view of the clouds is commendable and too good to be true. Yoho National Park: Similar to the Kootenay Park, Yoho National Park too offers nature lovers a great experience. You will be in awe and wonder when you explore the rock walls, waterfalls and mountain peaks at this park. Stanley Park: This simple and sweet park is often known as the jewel of Vancouver. It is a paradise for those who love biking, beaches and enjoy scenic views. Well, these were just few parks in the two destinations, which you can cover. You can research online and find out many more stunning views. Since Canada is filled with breathtaking parks, you will have to visit this country often.
